channel.title: Comments on: Android USB Tethering in UBUNTU 12.04
channel.description: Don't document the program; program the document.

item.title: By: tanius
item.dc:creator: tanius
item.description: Thanks!!, I got it to work as well with your explanations. I had to add the two lines to /etc/network/interfaces like you say, but did not need the "sudo reload smbd" command. Instead I believe this is just given as an example in the message output, referring to the the Samba network file system daemon (which has nothing to do with network connections). The message is just proposing a "better way", your "sudo ifup usb0" got executed anyway. In my case however I did not need ifup, but this command: "sudo restart network-manager". Since I use the Ubuntu NetworkManager, which is the default setting. Executing ifup should not be needed anyway, as this should be called by the ifplugd daemon when a cable is plugged in (at least this was the case for wired Ethernet in ubuntu 11.04 or so).
item.content:encoded:
Thanks!!, I got it to work as well with your explanations.
I had to add the two lines to /etc/network/interfaces like you say, but did not need the “sudo reload smbd” command.
Instead I believe this is just given as an example in the message output, referring to the the Samba network file system daemon (which has nothing to do with network connections). The message is just proposing a “better way”, your “sudo ifup usb0” got executed anyway.
In my case however I did not need ifup, but this command: “sudo restart network-manager”. Since I use the Ubuntu NetworkManager, which is the default setting.
Executing ifup should not be needed anyway, as this should be called by the ifplugd daemon when a cable is plugged in (at least this was the case for wired Ethernet in ubuntu 11.04 or so).

item.title: By: Pavan
item.dc:creator: Pavan
item.description: Thank you it worked for me by just adding the usb0 entries to interfaces file and then replugged the phone.
item.content:encoded: Thank you it worked for me by just adding the usb0 entries to interfaces file and then replugged the phone.
